title: Fundamentals of Computer Science for Scientists and Engineers I
description: Introduction to the fundamentals of computer programming with an emphasis on mathematical, scientific and engineering applications: principles of algorithmic problem solving and procedural programming using a modern programming language, data types, elementary data structures, input/output and control structures. Not a substitute for CSC/CPE 101 for CSC/CPE majors or minors. 3 lectures, 1 laboratory.
prerequisites: MATH 141 or MATH 161 with a grade of C- or better, or consent of instructor.
